rulings.text: You control that player for the rest of the game, starting from the point the ability resolves.
If Tzhai's last ability is copied and redirected at the player who controls the original ability, the controller of the ability that resolves first will control both players.

If another player-control effect is applied to a controlled player, the controller of the most-recent control effect will control that player during that effects duration. If that effect doesn't have a duration (such as another Tzhai), the newer control effect will always prevail.

rulings.text: Marisa's first mate ability looks for cards using the game terms 'destroy', 'die', 'graveyard', and 'mill', not that exact arrangement of letters. This means Marisa can be the first mate of a deck running Hushbringer (which says "Creatures entering the battlefield or dying don't cause abilities to trigger."), but not Bloodied Ghost (which says "Bloodied Ghost enters the battlefield with a -1/-1 counter on it."

cards.name: Oriq Soulweaver
cards.originalText:
Whenever you cast a black spell, choose up to X, where X is the number of black mana symbols in that spell's mana cost —
• Target player loses 1 life and you gain 1 life.
• Put a -1/-1 counter on target creature.
• You draw a card and you lose 3 life.
• Exile target card in a graveyard.

rulings.text: Oriq Soulweaver checks the mana cost printed in the top right of the card, regardless of what cost was spent to cast the spell.

If a split card is cast, consider all of the faces being cast. For example, casting Flotsam (mana cost {U}) will not trigger Oriq Soulweaver, and casting Jetsam (mana cost {B}{B} or fusing Flotsam//Jetsam (mana cost {U}{B}{B}) will have X = 2.

cards.name: Spirit Script
cards.originalText:
Draw two cards, then discard a card.
Whenever you cast an instant or sorcery spell, if Spirit Script is in your graveyard, you may have it become a copy of that spell until end of turn.

rulings.text: If Spirit Script becomes a copy of a card and then leaves the graveyard, it will stop being a copy of the card. However, if it left the graveyard due to an ability allowing you to cast it (such as flashback or recite) it will keep that ability.

If an effect moves a Spirit Script that is copying a card from your graveyard and then asks for characteristics of that card (for example: Exile target card from a graveyard. If it was an instant, draw a card.) it will use the characteristics of the card Spirit Script was copying.

cards.text:

cards.name: Stay Determined
cards.originalText: Until end of turn, if a source you don't control would deal damage to you or cause you to lose life, mill that many cards instead.

rulings.text: If one or more replacement effects are being applied to you, for example Stay Determined and glory counters, you choose the order that they apply.
This card uses a replacement effect. This means the player who chooses which library will be affected in the case of multiple libraries can be messy to determine.
Life loss caused by combat damage has no controller. The player affected by the replacement effect will choose which libraries will be affected.
Life loss caused by spells and abilities either by direct life loss or by damage has the same controller as the spell or ability. That player will choose which libraries will be affected.

cards.name: Valencia of the Concordant
cards.originalText:
First mate—There are four or fewer different mana costs among nonland cards in your starting deck.
First strike
Each spell your opponents cast that would cost less than three mana to cast costs {1} more to cast.

rulings.text: Valencia’s ability affects the total cost of the spell. It is applied after any other cost increasers or cost reducers are applied: First apply any cost increases. Next apply any cost reducers. Finally look at the amount of mana you have to pay. If it’s less than three mana, you’ll pay an extra {1}. If there are multiple effects of this type, the caster of the spell applies them in any order they choose.

cards.name: Xirix, the Usurper
cards.originalText:
You may activate loyalty abilities of Xirix, the Usurper during extra turns any time you could cast an instant.
[+1]: Look at the top three cards of your library. Put one of them into your hand and the rest into your graveyard.
[-2]: Destroy each nonland, non-Xirix permanent with the greatest mana value among non-Xirix permanents on the battlefield.
[-6]: Put target permanent card from a graveyard onto the battlefield under your control.
